content: Do private streams never get demoted? Is that intentional? I have streams in my sidebar that haven't had messages for a year.
Hm, on another Zulip I definitely have private streams in the inactive section of the sidebar.
(I do on CZO too, now that I open the webapp.)
Pinned streams never get demoted; @Yash RE is it possible you pinned those streams?

They were definitely not pinned because they were not in the pinned section. However, now I no longer have those streams there. I did toggle the demotion setting a couple of times, and it's possible that's what fixed things.

I think stream demotion is based on how often you open the stream, not how often there are message, right? Since I've definitely had the experience of opening a stream that has been demoted and having that stick it in the non-demoted section for a while.
Yeah, I've experienced that too, but I don't think that's what's meant to happen... is it?

The demotion definitions are indeed based on whether you have any messages in your local cache from the stream; arguably that's correct since you might want to see streams you've visited during today's session even if they have old content.
But I could also imagine making that decision based on a more limited data source.
